issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify animal classes named Seal, Pig, and Goat (and the template's Main shows creating Seal, Pig, Goat). However, the solution repository defines the concrete implementations as SpaceSeal, SpacePig, and SpaceGoat (and the classes Seal.java, Pig.java, Goat.java in the solution repository are empty). This is a type/name mismatch between the expected types (Seal, Pig, Goat) and the solution's provided types (SpaceSeal, SpacePig, SpaceGoat). This discrepancy will confuse students: they will implement Seal/Pig/Goat per the exercise, but the solution uses different class names, and the solution's Main code references Seal/Pig/Goat that are missing. Students reading the solution repository may be unable to map its classes to the exercise specification or to run the provided example Main without renaming or adding wrapper classes.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution repository use the same class names/types as specified in the problem statement (Seal, Pig, Goat). Either rename SpaceSeal/SpacePig/SpaceGoat to Seal/Pig/Goat, or add concrete classes Seal, Pig, Goat that delegate to or extend the Space* implementations so their behavior and names match the exercise. Also ensure the solution's Main uses the same names expected by the problem (or update the problem/template to explicitly require the Space* names if that was intentional).

issues.description: The problem statement and template refer to the animal classes as Seal, Pig, and Goat (students are explicitly asked to implement Seal, Pig, Goat). The solution repository instead implements these entities with different class names: SpaceSeal, SpacePig, and SpaceGoat. This breaks the one-to-one mapping between the exercise requirements and the provided solution: students looking at the solution will find differently named classes (and printed Animal Types) and may be confused about which classes they are expected to implement or why the song prints e.g. 'SpaceSeal' instead of 'Seal'.
issues.suggested_fix: Make class names consistent across artifacts. Either (preferred) rename the solution classes to match the exercise names (SpaceSeal -> Seal, SpacePig -> Pig, SpaceGoat -> Goat) and update file names accordingly, or update the problem statement and template to consistently reference the 'Space' prefixed names. Renaming the solution classes to Seal/Pig/Goat will restore a direct and unambiguous mapping from problem requirements to implementation and avoid confusing printed animal types.
